Jimmy Carter Secretary of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . "He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure," Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself. Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn't work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler . Outside of the music industry, no one in the United States knew who Simon Cowell was until he started making nasty comments during the first season promotions for the show, he says. for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role_ and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.
